intro: Stilbe, commonly known as sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Crassulaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive blue or purple flowers and fleshy, often succulent leaves. Stilbe thrives in coastal environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils along the shore. The plant is adapted to salt spray and can tolerate harsh maritime conditions. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscaping.
